org.doctester.testbrowser

Class Request

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.doctester.testbrowser.Request

  • public class Request
extends Object
    This represents a Request we can pass then to the TestBrowser.
    Author:
    Raphael A. Bauer

      • contentTypeApplicationJson

        public Request contentTypeApplicationJson()
        Set the Content-Type header to application/json; charset=utf-8.
        Returns:
        This request for joining.

      • contentTypeApplicationXml

        public Request contentTypeApplicationXml()
        Set the Content-Type header to application/xml; charset=utf-8.
        Returns:
        This request for joining.

      • url

        public Request url(Url url)
        Set the Uri of this request. Usually you may want to use testServerUrl() from you Doctest and call toUri() at the end...
        Parameters:
        uri - The Uri of this request.
        Returns:
        This Request for chaining.

      • url

        public Request url(URI uri)
        Set the Uri of this request. Usually you may want to use testServerUrl() from you Doctest and call toUri() at the end...
        Parameters:
        uri - The Uri of this request.
        Returns:
        This Request for chaining.

      • addFileToUpload

        public Request addFileToUpload(String param,
                      File fileToUpload)
        Add a file to be sent as multipart form post/put. Only makes sense for POST and PUT Http requests.
        Parameters:
        param - The parameter for this file.
        fileToUpload - The file to upload
        Returns:
        This request for chaining.

      • addHeader

        public Request addHeader(String key,
                String value)
        Add an arbitrary header to this request.
        Parameters:
        key - The header key.
        value - The header value.
        Returns:
        This request for chaining.

      • headers

        public Request headers(Map<String,String> headers)
        Set headers for this request. This will wipe out all previously set headers.
        Parameters:
        headers - A map of header keys and header values to use.
        Returns:
        This request for chaining.

      • addFormParameter

        public Request addFormParameter(String key,
                       String value)
        Add an arbitrary form parameter to this request. Only makes sense for POST or PUT requests.
        Parameters:
        key - The header key.
        value - The header value.
        Returns:
        This request for chaining.

      • formParameters

        public Request formParameters(Map<String,String> formParameters)
        Set form parameters for this request. Only makes sense for POST or PUT requests. Wipes out all previously set formParameters.
        Parameters:
        formParameters - Map of formParemter keys and values to use.
        Returns:
        This request for chaining.

      • payload

        public Request payload(Object payload)
        Set the payload for this request. String will be just sent as strings. If you set Content-Type json or xml this Object will converted into the appropriate representation. Calling this method multiple times will overwrite the payload.
        Parameters:
        payload - The payload to use.
        Returns:
        This request for chaining.

      • followRedirects

        public Request followRedirects(boolean followRedirects)
        Follow redirects automatically. Or simply do only one request and stop then.
        Parameters:
        followRedirects - Whether to follow redirects or no.
        Returns:
        This request for chaining.
